00056 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00057 #include <config.h>
00058 #include <library/select_sort.h>
00059 
00060 #undef DEBUG
00061 
00062 #define SELECTION_SORT
00063 
00064 #ifdef SELECTION_SORT
00065 /*
00066  *      Sort according to the least weight order.
00067  *      Return 0 if the array is uniquely sorted
00068  *      (all elements have different weights).
00069  *      Otherwise the array is not uniquely sorted
00070  *      for entries with identical weights, and a
00071  *      non-zero value is returned.
00072  */
00073 int
00074 min_sort (ST_Entry * array, int size)
00075 {
00076   int i, j, max, equal = 0;
00077   int ti;
00078   void *tp;
00079   double tw;
00080   /* each time identify the largest element in 
00081    * array[0, i] and move it to the array[i] position.
00082    */
00083   for (i = size - 1; i >= 1; i--)
00084     {
00085       max = 0;                  /* assume array[0] is the largest */
00086       for (j = 1; j <= i; j++)
00087         {
00088           if (array[max].weight == array[j].weight)
00089             {
00090               equal++;
00091             }
00092           else if (array[max].weight < array[j].weight)
00093             {
00094               max = j;
00095             }
00096         }
00097       /* swap(max, i) */
00098       ti = array[max].index;
00099       tp = array[max].ptr;
00100       tw = array[max].weight;
00101       array[max].index = array[i].index;
00102       array[max].ptr = array[i].ptr;
00103       array[max].weight = array[i].weight;
00104       array[i].index = ti;
00105       array[i].ptr = tp;
00106       array[i].weight = tw;
00107     }
00108   return (equal != 0);
00109 }
00110 /*
00111  *      Sort according to the maximum weight order.
00112  *      Return 0 if the array is uniquely sorted
00113  *      (all elements have different weights).
00114  *      Otherwise the array is not uniquely sorted
00115  *      for entries with identical weights, and a
00116  */
00117 int
00118 max_sort (ST_Entry * array, int size)
00119 {
00120   int i, j, min, equal = 0;
00121   int ti;
00122   void *tp;
00123   double tw;
00124   /* each time identify the smallest element in 
00125    * array[0, i] and move it to the array[i] position.
00126    */
00127   for (i = size - 1; i >= 1; i--)
00128     {
00129       min = 0;                  /* assume array[0] is the smallest */
00130       for (j = 1; j <= i; j++)
00131         {
00132           if (array[min].weight == array[j].weight)
00133             {
00134               equal++;
00135             }
00136           else if (array[min].weight > array[j].weight)
00137             {
00138               min = j;
00139             }
00140         }
00141       /* swap(min, i) */
00142       ti = array[min].index;
00143       tp = array[min].ptr;
00144       tw = array[min].weight;
00145       array[min].index = array[i].index;
00146       array[min].ptr = array[i].ptr;
00147       array[min].weight = array[i].weight;
00148       array[i].index = ti;
00149       array[i].ptr = tp;
00150       array[i].weight = tw;
00151     }
00152   return (equal != 0);
00153 }
00154 #endif
00155 
00156 #ifdef DEBUG
00157 #include <stdio.h>
00158 void
00159 main ()
00160 {
00161   int n;
00162   static ST_Entry array[100];
00163   for (n = 0; n < 100; n++)
00164     {
00165       array[n].index = n;
00166       array[n].ptr = 0;
00167       array[n].weight = 100.0 - (double) n;
00168     }
00169   n = min_sort (array, 6);
00170   printf ("unique = %d\n", n);
00171   for (n = 0; n < 10; n++)
00172     {
00173       printf ("(%d %f)\n", array[n].index, array[n].weight);
00174     }
00175 }
00176 #endif
